title: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
summary: A rich and hearty Italian pasta dish made with slow-cooked beef, tomatoes, and herbs.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and cook until soft and translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon.
Stir in tomato paste, canned tomatoes, oregano, and basil.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Reduce heat and let the sauce simmer for 20–25 minutes.
Serve the sauce over cooked spaghetti and top with grated Parmesan.

title: Grilled Chicken Salad
summary: A healthy and refreshing salad with grilled chicken, fresh vegetables, and a light vinaigrette.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and brush with olive oil.
Grill chicken for 6–7 minutes per side or until fully cooked.
Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
In a large bowl, combine salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and avocado.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard.
Add sliced grilled chicken on top of the salad.
Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss gently before serving.

title: Fluffy Pancakes
summary: Light and fluffy homemade pancakes perfect for breakfast or brunch.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the egg and mix with milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined (do not overmix).
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface (about 2 minutes).
Flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
Serve warm with maple syrup and your favorite toppings.
